it.uniud.mads.jlibbig.core.std

Class RewritingRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.uniud.mads.jlibbig.core.std.RewritingRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReactionRule<Bigraph>, RewritingRule<Bigraph,Bigraph>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AgentRewritingRule

    public class RewritingRule
extends java.lang.Object
implements RewritingRule<Bigraph,Bigraph>
    A rewriting rule is a reaction rule described by means of rewrites i.e. the reaction is a substitution of an occurrence (in the bigraph to which the rule is applied) of the rule's redex with the rule's reactum. Redex and reactum of a rewriting rule are described by means of two bigraphs (getRedex() and getReactum()). Occurrences are described by matches (cf. Match) i.e. triples like where F is the juxtaposition of is the redex occurrence R and some suitable identity. Then R is replaced by the reactum R' and the parameter P is instantiated to P' in order to match R' inner interface. Parameter instantiation is handled by instantiation rule returned by getInstantiationRule(). Matches are computed by means of Matcher but the class allows to provide different matchers. During the rewrite, the reactum is instantiated by standard replication. Non-replicating attached properties such as SimpleProperty may be lost in the process; consider the use of self-replicating ones such as ReplicatingProperty or SharedProperty. Self-replicating properties may suit most scenarios but may be handy to intercept rectum node instantiation e.g. for adding or changing properties. This can be achieved by inheriting the method instantiateReactumNode(it.uniud.mads.jlibbig.core.std.Node, it.uniud.mads.jlibbig.core.std.Node, it.uniud.mads.jlibbig.core.std.Match).
    See Also:
    AgentRewritingRule

    • Method Detail

      • instantiateReactumNode

        protected void instantiateReactumNode(Node original,
                          Node instance,
                          Match match)
        This method is called during the instantiation of rule's reactum. Inherit this method to customise instantiation of Nodes e.g. attaching properties taken from nodes in the redex image determined by the given match.
        Parameters:
        original - The original node from the reactum.
        instance - The replica to be used.
        match - The match referred by the instantiation.

      • instantiateReactum

        protected final Bigraph instantiateReactum(Match match)
        Instantiates rule's reactum with respect to the given match.
        Parameters:
        match - the match with respect to the reactum has to be instantiated.
        Returns:
        the reactum instance.
